DataElement.preferredName: Non Cancer Frozen Submission Specimen Weight Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to identify the amount in milligrams associated with the non-cancer frozen tumor submitted for evaluation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Non Cancer Frozen Submission Specimen Weight
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host._Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others._A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold._The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.:Submission; a message submitted for the judgment of others.:A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created and released for TCGA per approval by T.Lichtenberg. mc 5/29/12

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.
